NAME
       msh - a ruby shell

SYNOPSIS
       msh [options]... [file]...

DESCRIPTION
       Msh is a simple shell running inside a ruby interpreter. It supports a
       small subset of sh.

       ·   [x] pipelines

       ·   [ ] command grouping

       ·   [ ] subshells

       ·   [ ] conditionals

       ·   [ ] multiple commands

       ·   [x] simple commands

       ·   [ ] redirection

       Additionally, it preprocesses your input as ERB, evaluated in the
       context of the shell, so you always have access to Ruby

           #{a = Date.today}
           echo "#{a}"
           cowsay #{IRB.start}

       See msh-design(1), msh-help(1), msh-history(1), msh-lexer(1),
       msh-parser(1).

OPTIONS
       -h, --help
           Show usage information.

       -V, --version
           Show the version.

       --copyright, --license
           Show the copyright.

       -c <command>
           Run a command string as input.
